text: The 2000 European Karate Championships, the 35th edition, was held in the sports complex of the National Indoor Arena in Istanbul, Turkey from May 2 to 4, 2000. ==Medallists== ===Men's Competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Luca Valdesi | Javier Hernández | Stephane Mari |- | Kumite -60 kg | Cécil Boulesnane | Hakan Yagli | Ales Bruna David Luque Camacho |- | Kumite -65 kg | Alexandre Biamonti | H. Abou El Alamein | Bahattin Kandaz Soufiane Sankhon |- | Kumite -70 kg | Haldun Alagas | Rida Bel Lahsen | Junior Lefevre Z. Stojovic |- | Kumite -75 kg | Iván Leal Reglero | Gennaro Talarico | Klaudio Farmadin Rouslan Sijajev |- | Kumite -80 kg | David Benetello | Okay Arpa | Seydina Balde Georg Petermann |- | Kumite Open | Predrag Stojadinov | Oscar Vazquez Martins | Konstantinos Papadopoulos Christophe Pinna |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | |- | Kumite | | | |} ===Women's competition=== ====Individual==== {| |- | Kata | Roberta Sodero | Myriam Szkudlarek | Miriam Cogolludo de la Herras |- | Kumite -53 kg | Nadia Mecheri | Michela Nanni | N. Gonenler Corrine Terrine |- | Kumite -60 kg | Katrina Lowe | Lott Berger | Gloria Casanova Rodriguez Alexandra Witteborn |- | Kumite +60 kg | Patricia Cherreau | Sonia Gomez | C. Hiotinga Nurhan Firat |- | Kumite Open | Yildiz Aras | Karina Gansch | Nathalie Leroy Petra Piskačová |} ====Team==== {| |- | Kata | | | |- | Kumite | | | |} ==References== ==External links== * Karate Records - European Championship 2000 2000 Category:International sports competitions hosted by Turkey European Karate Championships European championships in 2000 Category:Sport in Istanbul Category:2000s in Istanbul Category:Karate competitions in Turkey
